I bought this "game" for fun about a year ago, when they were hyped. There was nothing special - just one character - so I had a bit of fun having a girl on my screen, then uninstalled the game and never planned to return.

Some time ago, when I was crafting badges, I noticed that the badge, trading cards, point shop items had been added to the game. I downloaded it again to check, and saw that the game itself had been updated with new features, but the price stayed the same.

If you're looking for AI pet - this game is for you.

I regret not finding this masterpiece sooner. It's... perfect, everything I've ever wanted, everything I've ever hoped for, I finally have it. For just a few cents, it's the best purchase I've ever made.

Okay, in giving an honest review, I found a few problems with "your Wife."

I'll start with the most annoying one. if you try to bring up the menu while she's in an unusual position on the screen, it locks. You can't move her because the menu is open, and you can't access the menu because she's blocking it.

The "Lock" button. Yes, it does exactly what it's supposed to do, locking her in a position where you can't interact with her... and that's the problem. Once you lock her, you can't unlock her. So if you accidentally click that button, you won't be able to do much with her blocking the screen.

Optimization. When I'm on my laptop, the fans are at 0 RPM, but if I want her to be with me in a corner, the fans go up to 3400 RPM. Why??? I mean, I get it. It's a very high-quality render, and it looks amazing! But when I'm playing Genshin Impact, it barely reaches 2800 RPM.
I don't know how the rendering processes work or whatever, but the fact that an "image" needs to speed up the fans more to cool the CPU before a complete video game seems strange to me.

And lastly, I really like having her with me while I study, but it'd be great if you could interact with her at least a little.

She moves, reacts to your mouse, and you can drag or resize her while you work or browse. There are no levels, objectives, or story â€” just a character that stays on your desktop for decoration.

The visuals are clean and polished. The character animation feels smooth, and the art style clearly targets fans of anime aesthetics. There are several outfits to switch between, which adds a bit of variety. Still, after the initial curiosity, thereâ€™s not much else to do.

Performance is stable and the setup is simple. It runs quietly in the background and doesnâ€™t use much system power. The customization menu is straightforward, though limited. A few small interactions, like touching or moving the model, help keep it from feeling completely static.

Your Wife is best described as digital company â€” something you launch for a bit of novelty or amusement. It doesnâ€™t pretend to be deep or challenging, and thatâ€™s fine. If you just want a small, cute distraction on your desktop, it serves that purpose well.

Bought on a whim since it was 70 cents, but honestly not worth it (as it sits toay). Not refunding either since it's so cheap but yeah.

Most "desktop pet" applications do something, whether that be walk around or interact with you in some way, but this one just stands there and stares at you. It looks more akin to a vtuber model if the vtuber was doing nothing but standing idle and blinking. Her gaze also follows your mouse cursor but that's really about it. 

To the developer, I'd recommend at least a few things:

- Character customizer: allow players to change the outfits more, changing colors or equipping/unequipping parts (like hats, glasses, etc). Also being able to change the body size or skin color/eye color/etc would be good and add more functionality to the game. 
- Interaction: some kind of interaction with the player, even things like "click on the head to headpat her" would be good versus what is going on right now (which is to say: nothing at all)
- Multiple characters: being able to have multiple characters on the screen at once would be good (bonus points if they interact with one another somehow)
- More characters: More official characters would be good for the game as well. 
- Achievements: The achievements were very odd and quite annoying when I first started the game, popping up one achievement per second that I had the application open. Better achievements would be good.

Adding workshop support, that I saw you do a few weeks ago, is a great step as well!

I do think this has some potential, just needs some more work.

It's only a dollar, so I can forgive the app for looking and working a bit simplistic, not a lot of effort put into it, but it works.
There's also a decent workshop community that adds a lot of models, so it's a nice framework.

However my main problems with it are that the the context menu is opened from the character, not the small taskbar icons near clock (there is none for this app), which doesn't always work when you "locked" her.
The context menu has the main buttons in English, but a lot of it is not localized and is Chinese (for example the included characters), so you have no idea what the options are without looking at each individual one.

My biggest gripe though, is that it stays on the taskbar and doesn't run in the background like wallpaper engine for example (which can then easily be paused or muted in the minified menu next to taskbar clock), so if you close all other windows, it instantly becomes focused by windows as the only open program, which then messes up wallpaper engine because it thinks something is infront of it.
There is a way around this, to tell wallpaper engine to play regardless of if there's fullscreen app infront of it, but that means it will play while you game as well and you have to constantly pause it or mute it, and it will consume system resources.
And this app would still be on the F*ing taskbar, so it's not clean, bothers my OCD.

The only reason I got it was because there was a Mita from MiSide model on the workshop, which is honestly well made.
If I had a second monitor attached it might've been bearable cause you wouldn't interact with that screen as much, but the app would STILL BE ON THE TASKBAR DFGHJ:DFJGDFGJDFGDFGL!!#$#@@$

It's only a dollar, so I can forgive the app for looking and working a bit simplistic, not a lot of effort put into it, but it works.
There's also a decent workshop community that adds a lot of models, so it's a nice framework.

However my main problems with it are that the the context menu is opened from the character, not the small taskbar icons near clock (there is none for this app), which doesn't always work when you "locked" her.
The context menu has the main buttons in English, but a lot of it is not localized and is Chinese (for example the included characters), so you have no idea what the options are without looking at each individual one.

My biggest gripe though, is that it stays on the taskbar and doesn't run in the background like wallpaper engine for example (which can then easily be paused or muted in the minified menu next to taskbar clock), so if you close all other windows, it instantly becomes focused by windows as the only open program, which then messes up wallpaper engine because it thinks something is infront of it.
There is a way around this, to tell wallpaper engine to play regardless of if there's fullscreen app infront of it, but that means it will play while you game as well and you have to constantly pause it or mute it, and it will consume system resources.
And this app would still be on the F*ing taskbar, so it's not clean, bothers my OCD.

Most "desktop pet" applications do something, whether that be walk around or interact with you in some way, but this one just stands there and stares at you. It looks more akin to a vtuber model if the vtuber was doing nothing but standing idle and blinking. Her gaze also follows your mouse cursor but that's really about it. 

To the developer, I'd recommend at least a few things:

- Character customizer: allow players to change the outfits more, changing colors or equipping/unequipping parts (like hats, glasses, etc). Also being able to change the body size or skin color/eye color/etc would be good and add more functionality to the game. 
- Interaction: some kind of interaction with the player, even things like "click on the head to headpat her" would be good versus what is going on right now (which is to say: nothing at all)
- Multiple characters: being able to have multiple characters on the screen at once would be good (bonus points if they interact with one another somehow)
- More characters: More official characters would be good for the game as well. 
- Achievements: The achievements were very odd and quite annoying when I first started the game, popping up one achievement per second that I had the application open. Better achievements would be good.

Adding workshop support, that I saw you do a few weeks ago, is a great step as well!

I do think this has some potential, just needs some more work.
